property.name: Text

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ά (X), where X is your location's shelter's value. If you fail, you must decide (choose one): — Take 1 horror for each point you failed by. — Place 2 of your clues on your location. Add 1 [Frost] token to the chaos bag.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Put Zero Visibility into play in your threat area. As an additional cost for you to leave a location with a treachery attached to it, you must spend 1 action. Forced – At the end of your turn: Test ί (2). If you succeed, discard Zero Visibility.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced – After a location is entered by an investigator for the first time: Put into play each set-aside location connected to that location. (Use the map in the Campaign Guide for reference.)

property.name: Text
property.value: Each investigator, including those who are eliminated, shuffles the top card of the Tekeli-li deck into their deck. Choose a location in play with no clues on it. Each undefeated investigator moves to that location and immediately resigns. The higher that location's shelter value, the better. If the investigators cannot chose such a location, they must move to the Crash Site and immediately resign, even if they otherwise could not. (Then, resolve the Objective on act 1a.)

property.name: Text
property.value: η If each investigator is at the same location and that location has no clues on it: Resign. You set up camp. Each investigator resigns. Objective – Find somewhere safe to set up camp. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance. The higher the shelter value of the location they resigned at, the better.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hunter. Massive. Terror of the Stars gets +3π heatlh. While Terror of the Stars is ready, investigators cannot resign at its location or discover clues at its location. Victory 1.

property.name: Text

property.name: Text
property.value: θ Investigators at your location spend 1π clue, as a group: Draw the encounter card beneath your location. η If you are at camp: Resign. You turn in for the night. Objective – Find as many missing expedition members as you can by adding them to the victory display, then head back to camp before daybreak. If each undefeated investigator has resigned, advance.

property.name: Text

If there are 1 or more cards beneath it, choose one of them at random and spawn it at its location. If there are no cards beneath it, it moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase (without exhausting).

property.value: Spawn 1 set-aside copy of The Nameless Madness enemy at the Mist-Pylon nearest to an investigator. __________________ Check the Campaign Log. After resolving all of them, shuffle each of them back into their bearer's deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced – When 1 or more doom would be put into play, if there are any copies of The Nameless Madness still set-aside: Instead, spawn 1 set-aside copy of The Nameless Madness at the location nearest to an investigator without a copy of that enemy. Objective – At the end of the round, if all 15 copies of The Nameless Madness are in play and not every Mist-Pylon is collapsed, advance this agenda.

property.name: Text
property.value: For each Mist-Pylon that is collapsed, set 3 copies of The Nameless Madness aside. Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove each location except The Gate of Y'quaa from the game. Investigators and copies of The Nameless Madness are not defeated by this effect. All other cards at these locations are discarded. Put the 4 set-aside Titanic Ramp locations into play in a straight line to the right of The Gate of Y'quaa. Put the set-aside Hidden Tunnel location into play to the right of the rightmost TItanic Ramp.Place each investigator and each remaining copy of The Nameless Madness in play at the leftmost Titanic Ramp. Remove the act deck from the game and advance to the set-aside The Final Mirage. It is both the current act and the current agenda.

property.name: Text
property.value: Each revealed Mist-Pylon can be attacked as if it were an enemy. Its fight value is equal to its shroud value and its health is equal to its clue value. While it has no health remaining, it is collapsed (it remains in play). ι When you discover 1 or more clues at a Mist-Pylon, spend those clues: Deal that much damage to that Mist-Pylon. Objective – At the end of the round, if each Mist-Pylon is collapsed, advance this act.

property.name: Text

Put the 4 set-aside Titanic Ramp locations into play in a straight line to the right of The Gate of Y'quaa.
